SE&ydot;nt Nichola&slong; þe holie Man man &punctelev; þat guod confe&slong;&slong;our wa&slong;
Of heiȝe men he wa&slong; icome &punctelev; In In þe cite of patra&slong; Patras
Fo&rrot; in patras Patras he wa&slong; ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; nelle ich þarof nouȝt l&ydot;e
his moder name was Ione &punctelev; his fadere&slong; epiphanie Epiphanie
Þe fur&slong;te da&ydot; þat he wa&slong; ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; þat child þat wa&slong; &slong;o guod
A&slong;e it wa&slong; in ane mele ibaþed &punctelev; alone up&rrot;iȝt it &slong;tod
Ano Anon &slong;o he wa&slong; ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; and he gan to beo guod and clene
he nolde fridai Fridai ne wodn&slong;sda&ydot; Wodnesday &punctelev; &slong;ouke nouȝt bote ene
Þo he couþe gon ant &slong;peke &punctelev; he ne pleide neuere mo
Ake ȝwane oþur child&rrot;en rageden[o&rrot;ig. raieden] fa&slong;te &punctelev; to churche he wolde go
he nolde &slong;peke non &ydot;del wo&rrot;d &punctelev; a&slong;e swuche child&rrot;en doth
Leiȝingue and pleiȝe&slong; and ragingue&slong; &punctelev; he bilefte al&slong;o
Þo he wa&slong; &slong;ethþe of gretto&rrot;e elde &punctelev; to &slong;cole he wa&slong; i&slong;et
So wel he leo&rrot;nede &punctelev; þat man nu&slong;te no child leo&rrot;ni bet
Sethþe þo he mo&rrot;e couþe &punctelev; al his &slong;tudie he tok
to guode&slong;pelles ant to holi w&rrot;ites &punctelev; and alle oþere boke&slong; fo&rrot;&slong;ok
So clene lijf he ladde ȝong &punctelev; þat deinte it wa&slong; to wite
Mo&rrot;e godne&slong;&slong;e ne miȝte beo &punctelev; þane we findeth of him iw&rrot;ite
Þo is fader and is moder weren dede &punctelev; þis holie child Nicholas
lu&ydot;te tolde of heo&rrot;e guode &punctelev; þei he heo&rrot;e e&ydot;r was
to pouere Men men he ȝaf it clene &punctelev; ȝware he &slong;aiȝ neode
And heo þat nolden bidde him non &punctelev; &slong;tilleliche he gan hem beode
An heiȝ Man man þare wa&slong; biside &punctelev; þat sethþe þo&rrot;uȝ luþer cas
his guod wa&slong; al clene awei igo &punctelev; and al pouere bicome he was
he hadde þ&rrot;e douȝtren faire inouȝ &punctelev; clene and guode also
In &slong;o gret Me&slong;ei&slong;e meseise heo weren ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; þat heo nu&slong;ten ȝwat to do
Þo heo nu&slong;ten ȝwarebi libbe &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e guod heom wa&slong; binome
heo&rrot;e red hu&ydot; nomen alle þ&rrot;eo &punctelev; fole wommen to bicome
And raþer þanne heo in &slong;wuche houngur weren &punctelev; to libbe bi heo&rrot;e hore dom
Þe olde man heo&rrot; alre fader &punctelev; gret deol to him he nom
gret pite hadde in is heo&rrot;te &punctelev; þe guode seint Nicholas
Þo he iheo&rrot;de þe deolfole mone &punctelev; þat among heom alle wa&slong;
Of is fader guode a n&ydot;ȝt &punctelev; ane beiȝ of gold he nam
Iwounde in one cloute &punctelev; and &slong;tilleliche to heo&rrot;e heo&rrot;e hou&slong;e he cam
to a derne w&ydot;ndouwe &slong;ofteliche &punctelev; seint Nicholas gan gon
And ca&slong;te in þat gold p&rrot;iueliche &punctelev; and wende aȝein anon
Þis hou&slong;ebonde aros aMo&rrot;uwe amoruwe &punctelev; ant þarof nu&slong;te nouȝt
he com and fond þane beiȝ of gold &punctelev; þat &slong;eint Nicholas hadde ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þarof he wa&slong; glad inouȝ &punctelev; þei he nu&slong;te ho it b&rrot;ouȝte
he it nam and þonkede Ie&slong;u cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat on is me&slong;ei&slong;e þouȝte
Þarewith he con&slong;eilede &slong;w&ydot;þe wel &punctelev; his elde&slong;te douȝter &slong;one
With fair b&rrot;u&ydot;dale and gret honour &punctelev; a&slong;e riȝt wa&slong; fo&rrot;to done
Seint Nicholas i&slong;aiȝ al þis &punctelev; and naþele&slong; ȝu&ydot;t he þouȝte
Þat þis &slong;elie Man man neode hadde &punctelev; þat he mo&rrot;e guod to him b&rrot;ouȝte
A niȝt he awaitede &slong;w&ydot;þe wel &punctelev; a&slong;e o&rrot;e louerd it wolde
37
And at one fene&slong;tre ca&slong;te In in eft&slong;one &punctelev; ane oþur beiȝ of golde
Þi&slong; hou&slong;ebonde amo&rrot;ewe aros &punctelev; þat gold he fond &slong;one
he þonkede god God with guode heo&rrot;te &punctelev; þat hadde iheo&rrot;d is bone
And nathele&slong; him wond&rrot;ede muche &punctelev; ho is freond &slong;o wel were
And þouȝte þat he awaiti wolde &punctelev; ȝif he mo&rrot;e come þere
he con&slong;eilede is oþur douȝter &punctelev; &slong;wiþe wel with þi&slong; golde
With gret nobleie and fa&ydot;&rrot; b&rrot;u&ydot;dale &punctelev; a&slong;e o&rrot;e louerd it wolde
Ȝeot þouȝte þi&slong; guode Nicholas &punctelev; þo þis wa&slong; al ido
Þat it were guod to con&slong;eili &punctelev; þe þ&rrot;idde douȝter also
A niȝt he wende wel &slong;tilledliche &punctelev; to þat fene&slong;tre eft&slong;one
And ca&slong;te In in ane beiȝ of gold &punctelev; a&slong;e he was iwoned to done
Þis hou&slong;ebonde hadde iwaked longue &punctelev; fo&rrot;to wa&ydot;ti of þis cas
So þat þo seint Nichola&slong; cam &punctelev; wakiende he wa&slong;
Op he &slong;turte and &slong;iwede him &punctelev; and bi is cloþus heold him fa&slong;te
he ne let nouȝt go are þe guode man &punctelev; ikneuȝ him at þe la&slong;te
Ȝeo&rrot;ne bad &slong;eint Nichola&slong; &punctelev; þat he to no man ne &slong;ede
Þe ȝw&ydot;le þat he aliue were &punctelev; of þis p&rrot;iue dede
With þis gold þe þ&rrot;idde douȝter &punctelev; wel icon&slong;eilled wa&slong;
And alle þ&rrot;eo weren riche[al. gode] wiue&slong; &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ &slong;eint Nicholas
In þis manere &slong;eint Nichola&slong; &punctelev; a&slong;e ich nouþe habbe i&slong;ed
Delde al is heritage &punctelev; þo is fader wa&slong; ded
Ȝwane oþur Men men eoden to habbe &slong;olas &punctelev; he nadde þarto ne no wille
to churche he wolde &punctelev; and in one hu&ydot;&rrot;ne &punctelev; is beden bidde wel &slong;tille
e&ydot;ar¶Hit bifeol þat þe bi&slong;chop &punctelev; of Mirre wa&slong; dedI am not sure what the marginal notation says--or even what language it is in.
And folk cam to cheo&slong;e aneoþur &punctelev; and þarof h&ydot; nomen heo&rrot;e red
So þat heo weren in ho&rrot;e beden &punctelev; n&ydot;ȝt and dai wel fa&slong;te
Þat o&rrot;e louerd heom &slong;ende ane guode man &punctelev; and he herde heom ate la&slong;te
Fo&rrot; a n&ydot;ȝt þare cam a voiz &punctelev; a&slong;e it were in metingue
to a bi&slong;chop þat was mai&slong;ter þer &punctelev; and tolde him þi&slong; t&ydot;þingue
And &slong;eide goth tomo&rrot;ewe ˇto churche|
⁁ &slong;one &punctelev; riȝt are hit dai beo·NB. The Unicode caron used for an upside down caret is not a MUFI recommendation. In the MUFI documentation, the caron is only found combined with other characters.
Þe fur&slong;te man þat ȝe þare mouwen &punctelev; iheo&rrot;e oþur i&slong;eo
And þat hote Nicholas &punctelev; takez him wel &slong;one
And makez him bi&slong;chop of Mirre &punctelev; god God hath iheo&rrot;d ower bone
þe bi&slong;chop and þat oþur folk &punctelev; ari&slong;en are hit dai were
And comen to churche and founden &slong;one &punctelev; Nichola&slong; &slong;tonde þere
In one hu&ydot;rne he &slong;tod ful &slong;tille &punctelev; heo axeden ȝwat he wa&slong;
And ȝwat were is riȝte name &punctelev; he &slong;eide hem Nicholas
heo nomen and ladden him with gret honour &punctelev; to þe churche of Mirree
And &slong;acreden him to bi&slong;chop þere &punctelev; and &slong;etten him in is &slong;e
Þo he wa&slong; heiȝ man imaked &punctelev; þis guode Nicholas
Mo&rrot;e bouȝ&slong;um and milde he bicam &punctelev; þane euer er
he wa&slong;
lu&ydot;te p&rrot;u&ydot;te he hadde of is power &punctelev; ȝwane men him wolden aloute
And ȝif it nere fo&rrot; eiȝe of god God &punctelev; leouere him were withoute
So p&rrot;e&slong;t he wa&slong; to alle men &punctelev; þat on him beden  & cride
And &slong;o muche fo&rrot; heom he dude &punctelev; þat men &slong;peken þarof wide
·37·
Muche folk In in a time &punctelev; Into þe se iwende
In a &slong;chip to don heo&rrot;e neode &punctelev; ȝif o&rrot;e louerd þe grace heom &slong;ende
So þat þere cam a gret tempe&slong;te &punctelev; þat heo wenden alle ad&rrot;enche
Alle guodne&slong;&slong;e heo biheiȝten god God &punctelev; þat heo miȝten on biþenche
So þat heo þouȝten a&slong;e heo&rrot;e schip &punctelev; toward þe grounde was
On þe guodne&slong;&slong;e þat men tolden &punctelev; of þe bi&slong;chop Nicholas
Leoue louerd Nichola&slong; &punctelev; wel loude alle heo criden
Ȝif it is[MS. it] soth þat we habbez &punctelev; iheo&rrot;d tellen of þe wide
In þis peril &slong;aue us nouþe &punctelev; þat we ne beon ad&rrot;eint
Louerd Nicholas help us nouþe &punctelev; are o&rrot;e schip beo aseint
A&slong;e heo gradden þare cam on eo&rrot;ne &punctelev; onowarde þe watere biside
A bi&slong;chop in abite &slong;wiþe fair &punctelev; wel loude on him hu&ydot; cride
Lo me here quath þis holie man &punctelev; ȝe cleopeden me wel fa&slong;te
Seggez ȝwat ouwer wille beo &punctelev; and ȝwarof ȝe beon aga&slong;te
Louerd heo &slong;eiden Nicholas &punctelev; ȝif it is þi wille
Saue us nouþe of þis tempe&slong;te &punctelev; þat we he[re][MS. he] ne a&slong;pille
Ne habbe ȝe quath þis holie man &punctelev; herof none d&rrot;ede
Þat weder bicam þo &slong;tille inouȝ &punctelev; þo he þeo&slong; wo&rrot;de&slong; &slong;ede
heo biheolden þo after him &punctelev; heo nu&slong;ten ȝware he wa&slong;
And þonkeden muche o&rrot;e &slong;wete louerd &punctelev; and þene bi&slong;chop Nicholas
Þene wei &slong;tille and murie &punctelev; toward þe londe hu&ydot; nome
Withoute eche de&slong;tourbingue &punctelev; to londe wel glade heo come
Alle heo duden heom fo&rrot;t anon &punctelev; to þe bi&slong;chope Nicholas
A&slong;e to a man þat heo neuere ne &slong;eiȝen &punctelev; ne nu&slong;ten ȝwuch he was
Ech of heom biheolden him fa&slong;te &punctelev; þat to þis guode man com
Alle heom þouȝte þat it wa&slong; he &punctelev; þat þene deth heom binam
Louerd heo &slong;eiden ihered þou beo &punctelev; to þe we gradden bliue
Onouewarde þe se þo þou come &punctelev; and b&rrot;ouȝte&slong;t us to liue
Ihered beo þe t&ydot;me þat þou mo&slong;t &punctelev; among men on eo&rrot;þe beo
Fo&rrot; &slong;wuche grace ne hadde neuere eo&rrot;þelich Man man &punctelev; a&slong;e man ma&ydot; on þe ise
Þis guode Man man þo he iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; þonkede and herede al&slong;o
Ore louerd þat wolde fo&rrot; is loue &punctelev; su&ydot;ch miracle do
¶Hit bifeol In in ane oþur t&ydot;me &punctelev; of þe bi&slong;chop Nicholas
Þat gret hongur alaboute &punctelev; In in is bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche wa&slong;
So luþere fullen þe ȝere&slong; alle &punctelev; þat no co&rrot;n nouȝwere na&slong;
gret deol hadde þis guode bi&slong;chop &punctelev; of þat luþere cas
Fram feo&rrot;rene contreie&slong; þare comen &slong;chipe&slong; &punctelev; with muche co&rrot;n þarebi&slong;ide
Þis bi&slong;chop wende aȝein heom &slong;one &punctelev; and bad heom one &slong;tounde abide
Fo&rrot; þe loue of Ie&slong;u cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; leneth me he &slong;ede
Ane hond&rrot;et qr&rabar;ters quarters of þat co&rrot;n &punctelev; þat ȝe þare doth lede
to þis &slong;elie men þat beoth here &punctelev; neiȝ fo&rrot; houngur dede
heo ne habbeth no co&rrot;n to libbe bi &punctelev; to &slong;ede ne to b&rrot;ede
Certe&slong; sire þis &slong;chipmen &slong;eiden &punctelev; þat ne do&rrot;re we nouȝt
Fo&rrot; al þis co&rrot;n þat þou i&slong;ixt &punctelev; þat we habbez here ib&rrot;ouȝt
With &slong;w&ydot;þe &slong;chars met withalle &punctelev; bitauȝt it is us echone
·37·
Þat we it leden þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour
&punctelev; ne do&rrot;re we make no lone
Withoute faille quath þis gode man &punctelev; ne d&rrot;edez ou riȝt nouȝt
Ȝif ȝe me wollez þarof lene &punctelev; þat eov &slong;chulle faili ouȝt
Þe folle ȝe &slong;chulle ȝelden þe Aum&pbardes;oure Aumperoure &punctelev; a&slong;e men token ou fo&rrot;to lede
Noþing ne &slong;chal ou failli &punctelev; ne þarf ov noþing d&rrot;ede
Þe schipmen ope tru&slong;te of is wo&rrot;d &punctelev; wel largeliche him mete
And token þe bi&slong;chope wel imetene &punctelev; Ane ane hound&rrot;ed qr&rabar;tere&slong; quarteres ȝwete
And wenden fo&rrot;th to þe Aumperour &punctelev; and is co&rrot;n him ladde
And beden is &slong;tiwarde&slong; meten wel &punctelev; ȝif heo þe folle hadden
hu&ydot; meten and founden al þe fulle &punctelev; and wel mo&rrot;e þareto
Fo&rrot; wonder heo axeden þe schipmen &punctelev; ȝwi it woxe so
heo þonkeden anon þane gode bi&slong;chop &punctelev; þat is neode to heom mende
And tolden fo&rrot;e þe Aum&pbardes;oure Aumperoure
&punctelev; hou muche co&rrot;n heo him lende
And hou he bihet heom þat it ne &slong;cholde &punctelev; þarefo&rrot;e ne wanie nouȝt
And hou heo hadden bi large met &punctelev; wel mo&rrot;e co&rrot;n ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þis guode bi&slong;chope heo hereden swiþe &punctelev; and þonkeden muche al&slong;o
Þat hadde þo&rrot;u o&rrot;e louerde&slong; grace &punctelev; swche miracle ido
Al þe contreie hadde inouȝ &punctelev; to mete and to &slong;ede
To ȝer and mo&rrot;e of þat co&rrot;n &punctelev; þat heo gonne þare lede
¶In an oþur t&ydot;me þis guode bi&slong;chop &punctelev; bi a fair treo com
he fond þare men þat duden þing &punctelev; aȝein heo&rrot;e cri&slong;tinedom Cristinedom
heo &slong;toden þare a&slong;e heo ofte duden &punctelev; and maden heo&rrot;e &slong;acrefi&slong;e
to þe deuel onder þis treo &punctelev; þat ⁁men miȝten þarof agri&slong;e
Seint Nicholas heom to&rrot;nede echone &punctelev; gode men fo&rrot;to be
And dude heom fo&rrot;&slong;ake þe feonde&slong; lo&rrot;e &punctelev; and hewe adoun þat treo
Þe deuel after þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; to him hadde gret onde
Fo&rrot;to abatien is pouwer &punctelev; in alle manere he gan fonde
pilegrime&slong; weren in þe se &punctelev; to &slong;eint Nichola&slong; fo&rrot;to wende
Fo&rrot; þe guodne&slong;&slong;e þat hu&ydot; of him herden &punctelev; ȝif god God heom wolde þe grace &slong;ende
In fourme of a fair womman &punctelev; þe deuel cam heom to
And &slong;eide louerdingue&slong; wel is eou &punctelev; þat ȝe mouwen ouwer wille do
Fo&rrot;to &slong;eche þis holie man &punctelev; þat so mil&slong;ful is and hende
Leouere ich hadde þane aniþing &punctelev; miȝte ich with ou wende
Fo&rrot; ich ne wilni noþing &slong;o muche &punctelev; a&slong;e þane holie man to &slong;eo
A lu&ydot;te þing ȝe moten fo&rrot; me don &punctelev; ȝwane it ne ma&ydot; oþur beo
Nimeth here þis guode o&ydot;gnement &punctelev; þat deo&rrot;ewurþe is withalle
And ȝwane ȝe into is churche comiet &punctelev; smeo&rrot;ieth in eche walle
Fo&rrot;to wurth&slong;chipien þane guode man &punctelev; þat is of so gret pou&slong;te
And ȝwane ich ne mai to him come &punctelev; doth þat In in þe mu&ydot;nde of me
Þis pilegrime&slong; with glade heo&rrot;te &punctelev; þis o&ydot;nement to heom nome
to &slong;merien with þi&slong; holie churche &punctelev; ȝwane heo þudere come
A&slong;e he wenden fo&rrot;th in þe se &punctelev; &slong;one it dude bifalle
Þat þare cam to heom a schip &punctelev; with faire men withalle
A bi&slong;chop þare wa&slong; among heom &punctelev; &slong;wiþe fair man and hende
he grette heom faire and axede anon &punctelev; ȝwodere heo þouȝten wende
·37· Nich 37 113·
heo &slong;eiden þat heo wolden &punctelev; ȝif it gode&slong; Godes wille were
to þe churche of Mirree &punctelev; fo&rrot;to Anouri anouri seint Nichola&slong; þere
Ȝwat wa&slong; þe womman þe bi&slong;chop &slong;eide &punctelev; þat ȝwile er eou cam to
And ȝwat wa&slong; it þat heo eou biteiȝte &punctelev; ȝwat &slong;chulle ȝe þarewith do
Sire it is an o&ydot;nement &punctelev; þeo&slong; pilegrime&slong; &slong;eden
Þe guode womman ȝeo&rrot;ne us bad &punctelev; to þe holie churche it lede
And þarewith in mu&ydot;nde of hire &punctelev; ȝwane it were þudere ib&rrot;ouȝt
Smeo&rrot;ie þe holie churche wowe&slong; &punctelev; þat we ne leten it nouȝt
Ȝe · ȝe · quath þis holie man &punctelev; ȝe nuten nouȝt ȝwat heo is
takez me þat o&ydot;nement &punctelev; and ȝe &slong;chullen iseo iwis
Þis guode man nam þat o&ydot;nement &punctelev; and amidde þe se it ca&slong;te
Þat watur bigan to berne anon &punctelev; aȝein is ku&ydot;nde wel fa&slong;te
Fram &slong;tude to &slong;tude þat fu&ydot;&rrot; o&rrot;n &punctelev; and barnde þe se iwis
Þo &slong;eide þe guode man here ȝe i&slong;eoth &punctelev; ȝwat ouwer o&ydot;nement is
hadde ȝe aniþing þarof &punctelev; on þe churchewalle&slong; ido
Al þe churche hadde fo&rrot;barnd &punctelev; and al þe toun also
hit wa&slong; þe foule feond of helle &punctelev; þat it ou tok with honde
Fo&rrot;to b&rrot;enne þulke churche &punctelev; fo&rrot; he haueth þarto onde
Fo&rrot;th wende þi&slong; bi&slong;chop and alle his &punctelev; anonriȝt þo&rrot;uȝ gode&slong; Godes &slong;onde
Þe pilegrime&slong; reoweden þene nexte we&ydot; &punctelev; so þat hu&ydot; comen to londe
to seint Nicholas heo wenden þo &punctelev; þat heo &slong;o wide &slong;ouȝte
Anon &slong;o heo i&slong;eiȝen þis guode man &punctelev; heo &slong;toden in grete þouȝte
heom þouȝte þat it þe bi&slong;chop wa&slong; &punctelev; þat in þe se to heom cam
Þat sche⁁wude hem þat o&ydot;nement &punctelev; and þe feonde&slong; sw&ydot;kedam
Louerd heo &slong;eiden noþv þin o&rrot;e &punctelev; muche is þi pouwer
Þat we i&slong;eiȝen in þe se &punctelev; are we comen her
heo hereden muche þene holie man &punctelev; a&slong; it wel riȝt wa&slong;
Þe guode man fa&slong;te heom fo&rrot;bed &punctelev; þat heo ne tolden nouȝt þis cas
Fairo&rrot;e Miracle miracle on eo&rrot;þe &punctelev; ne miȝte we neuere iwite
Þane we of seint Nicholas &punctelev; findeth ofte iwrite
In a t&ydot;me luþere men weo&rrot;reden &punctelev; þene Aumperour of rome Rome
And de&slong;tru&ydot;den is londe&slong; fa&slong;te &punctelev; and bataille aȝein him nome
Þe Aumperour nam þ&rrot;e grete louerdingue&slong; &punctelev; and oþere wel mani on
Fo&rrot;to wenden Iarmede iarmed sw&ydot;þe wel &punctelev; to fiȝten aȝein is fon
Þis þ&rrot;eo p&rrot;inces with heo&rrot;e men &punctelev; in þe se fo&rrot;th iwenden
to fiȝten aȝein is w&ydot;þerw&ydot;ne&slong; &punctelev; a&slong;e þe Aumperour heom &slong;ende
So þat þe w&ydot;nd heom d&rrot;of &punctelev; a&slong;e it were bi cas
to þe contreie of Mirree &punctelev; þare þis bi&slong;chop was
Þe bi&slong;chop heo&rrot;de of hem telle &punctelev; aȝen heom he wende &slong;one
And bad heom come and ete with him &punctelev; and hu&ydot; g&rabar;unteden graunteden is bone
Þis
þe guode man dude fo&rrot; heo ne &slong;cholden &punctelev; none robberie do
he made hem &slong;u&ydot;þe wel an a&ydot;&slong;e &punctelev; and fair &slong;emblaunt also
So þat þo&rrot;uȝ þis holie bi&slong;chop &punctelev; heo and heo&rrot;e fon
Withoute dunt oþur blod i&slong;ched &punctelev; aco&rrot;detd weren anon
Alto þe Aumpero&rrot;e&slong; guode &punctelev; ant to his honour also
Þeo&slong; þ&rrot;e mai&slong;tre&slong; wenden hamward &punctelev; þo þis dede wa&slong; ido
heo comen and tolden þe Aumperour &punctelev; hov heo hadden on itake
Þe Aumperour wa&slong; wel apa&ydot;d &punctelev; and gret fe&slong;te gan heom make
heo&rrot;e luþere felawe&slong; comen sone &punctelev; and þareto hadden envie
And &slong;eiden heo hadden þe Aumperoure &punctelev; idon gret treicherie
And with i&slong; fon imaked a fol pa&ydot;s &punctelev; and with grete feolonie
to þe de&slong;eriti&slong;un of þe Aumperour &punctelev; ope heom heo gunne l&ydot;e
Þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour in grete wrathþe &punctelev; let heom nime fa&slong;te
And binden þeos þ&rrot;e p&rrot;ince&slong; &punctelev; and in &slong;trongue p&rrot;i&slong;one ca&slong;te
So fa&slong;te weren þis luþere men &punctelev; ope þis p&rrot;ince&slong; þ&rrot;eo
Þat þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour swo&rrot; i&slong; oth &punctelev; Aslawe heo &slong;cholden beo
he let &slong;omon&ydot; is kn&ydot;ȝte&slong; alle &punctelev; þat heo amo&rrot;ewe come
Fo&rrot;to b&rrot;inguen þeo&slong; þ&rrot;eo p&rrot;ince&slong; &punctelev; to deþe þo&rrot;uȝ heo&rrot;e dome
Anon &slong;o þe tiþingue wa&slong; ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; to þis p&rrot;inces þ&rrot;eo
heo weopen and criden deolfulliche &punctelev; þat reuþe it wa&slong; to se
heo weopen and heo&rrot;e cloþe&slong; teren &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e her also
And þouȝten on þe grete godne&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; þat seint Nicholas hadde ido
Louerd heo &slong;eiden Nicholas &punctelev; fro ȝwam wel glade we eode
And al&slong;o wi&slong; a&slong;e we gultele&slong;e beoth &punctelev; help us in o&rrot;e neode
Ne lat us neuere þus gultele&slong;e &punctelev; to deþe beon ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þe holie bi&slong;chop Nichola&slong; &punctelev; ne furȝat heom nouȝt &punctelev;
Fo&rrot; a n&ydot;ȝt a&slong;e þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour
&punctelev; a&slong;e a louerd la&ydot; and a&slong;e a sire
Into is paleis þat wa&slong; &slong;o &slong;trong &punctelev; and ibarred al with ire
to him riȝt bifo&rrot;e his bed &punctelev; þis holi bi&slong;chop caom
And &slong;eide sire Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour ȝwat þenc&slong;t þou &punctelev; with þi fal&slong;e dom
Ȝwi ha&slong;t þou þis gultele&slong;e men &punctelev; In in þi p&rrot;i&slong;one ib&rrot;ouȝt
And gultele&slong; þenche&slong;t heom aquelle &punctelev; ich rede withd&rrot;auȝ þi þouȝt
Aris op &slong;one ich rede þe &punctelev; and lat heom of p&rrot;i&slong;one wende
Oþur ichulle mine louerd bidde &punctelev; þat he þe weo&rrot;re &slong;ende
Þat þareinne þou wo&rrot;&slong;t altoboned &punctelev; and ib&rrot;ouȝt of lijfdawe
Þat foule&slong; &slong;chullen and wilde be&slong;te&slong; &punctelev; þi caro&ydot;ne altod&rrot;awe
Ȝwat artov quath þe Aumperour &punctelev; oþur of ȝwat pou&slong;te
Þat in þis t&ydot;me art icome &punctelev; into mi pale&ydot;&slong; to me
And swuche bolde wo&rrot;de&slong; &slong;pext &punctelev; wonder me þinchez of þe
Ich am quath þis Nicholas &punctelev; bi&slong;chop of mirree Mirree
¶ Seint Nichola&slong; wende al&slong;o &punctelev; to þe Aumperoures heiȝe Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise
Þare he lai bi&slong;ide in þe pale&ydot;s &punctelev; and made him &slong;umdel agri&slong;e
Þov witle&slong;e w&rrot;echche he &slong;eide &punctelev; ȝwat haue&slong;tou iþouȝt
Ra&slong;tov þat þis gultele&slong;e men &punctelev; to deþe beon ib&rrot;ouȝt
Withd&rrot;auȝ þi red ich þe rede &slong;one &punctelev; oþur þou &slong;chalt al fo&rrot;dw&ydot;ne
And fo&rrot;leo&slong;e al þi guod &punctelev; and de&ydot;ȝe in &slong;trongue pine
Ȝwat artou þis oþur seide &punctelev; þat &slong;pext wo&rrot;de&slong; þu&slong; grete
And þe Aumpero&rrot;e&slong; heiȝe Iu&slong;ti&slong;e &punctelev; þus baldeliche dar&slong;t þ&rrot;ete
Ich am he &slong;eide Nichola&slong; &punctelev; bi&slong;chop of Mirree
bote þou withd&rrot;awe þi red &slong;one &punctelev; þou &slong;chalt ileue me
·37· 114
&dblsol;Þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour lai and q&rabar;kede quakede so&rrot;e &punctelev; and &slong;ende after is Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise
Þat wa&slong; al&slong;o &slong;o&rrot;e ad&rrot;ad &punctelev; and &slong;o&rrot;uful in eche wi&slong;e
E&ydot;þur tolde oþur fo&rrot;e &punctelev; hou he to heom &slong;eide
And wel baldeliche þ&rrot;etnede heom &punctelev; ȝwarefo&rrot;e heo weren in d&rrot;ede
Fo&rrot;to &slong;childen heom fram is w&rrot;athþe &punctelev; anoþur heo mo&slong;ten rede
Þis þ&rrot;e p&rrot;i&slong;one&slong; heo leten up nime &punctelev; and &slong;one bifo&rrot;e heom lede
Swiþe &slong;o&rrot;e heo weren ad&rrot;adde &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo wenden anon beo dede
To þe bi&slong;chop Nicholas &punctelev; reuliche heo gonne grede
beau&slong; amis
q&rabar;th quath þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour &punctelev; ȝwatmanere men beo ȝe
Þat þus þo&rrot;uȝ ouwer enchauntement &punctelev; aniȝt d&rrot;echcheth me
A &slong;ire merci þis oþure &slong;eide &punctelev; ȝwi wolle ȝe &slong;eggen so
Of anchauntement ne couþe we neuere &punctelev; ope god God we wollez u&slong; do
Ake gultele&slong;e men we buth &punctelev; with onriȝte hidere ib&rrot;ouȝt
Al&slong;o wi&slong; god God &slong;childe us fram þe deth &punctelev; a&slong;e we ne beth gultie nouȝt
Iknowe ȝe ani Man man quath þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour &punctelev; þat hote Nicholas
Þare na&slong; neuere on fo&rrot; þis wo&rrot;d &punctelev; þat in gre gret hope ne wa&slong;
heo&rrot;e hondene heo heolden op on heiȝ &punctelev; and wel loude gradden
to þe bi
bi&slong;chope Nicholas &punctelev; þat he reuþe of heom hadde
Þo&rrot;uȝ him quath þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour &punctelev; ȝe beth to liue ido
Ich ou ȝiue lijf and lime &punctelev; and ouwer chatele&slong; al&slong;o
goth nouþe ha&slong;teliche to him &punctelev; and tellez him wel bliue
hou þat fo&rrot; þe loue of him &punctelev; ich let ov gon aliue
biddeth þat he fo&rrot;ȝiue me is wrathþe &punctelev; and non harm fo&rrot; eu me do
Ake þat he bidde god God fo&rrot; me &punctelev; and fo&rrot; mi k&ydot;nedom al&slong;o
Þis p&rrot;i&slong;one&slong; wenden with glade heo&rrot;te &punctelev; to þe bi&slong;chope Nicholas
And þonkeden him a&slong;e heo auȝten wel &punctelev; of þis Io&ydot;fule ioyfule cas
Ich wene þere na&slong; neuere haluwe &punctelev; &slong;eint Nichola&slong;e&slong; iper
Þat so manie faire Miracle&slong; miracles &punctelev; bi is liue dude her
Fo&rrot; to come into &slong;o &slong;trong paleis &punctelev; and gon opon þe se al&slong;o
gret wonder wa&slong; þat anibodi &punctelev; &slong;wuch miracle miȝte do
Muche of þe ku&ydot;nde of heuene &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd here him &slong;ende
Aungle&slong; dede aliue to do &punctelev; are he henne&slong; iwende
Þo o&rrot;e louerde&slong; wille was &punctelev; þat he &slong;cholde henne&slong; w⁁iende
he bad o&rrot;e louerd þat he &slong;cholde &punctelev; aungle&slong; to him &slong;ende
Þo he i&slong;a&ydot; þe Aungle&slong; aungles to him come &punctelev; he þonkede o&rrot;e louerd fa&slong;te
Þe þ&rrot;ittiþe &slong;aume of þe sauter &punctelev; he bigan þus ate la&slong;te
In þe louerd ich habbe ihoped &punctelev; þat ich iconfundet ne beo
Þine holie ere beiȝ adoun to me &punctelev; heiȝe and deliuere me
he deide ate sixte vers &punctelev; þat on eglich&slong; Englichs to &slong;eggen is
Mine &slong;oule louerd ich bitake þe &punctelev; þou bouȝte&slong;t hire iwis
Þe &slong;oule out wende with þulke wo&rrot;de &punctelev; and þe Aungele&slong; aungeles fo&rrot;th hire bere
Alle þe felaweschipe&slong; of heuene &punctelev; wel glade þerewith were
he deide þ&rrot;e hound&rrot;et ȝer &punctelev; and in þe þ&rrot;eo and fourt&ydot;þe ȝere
After þat god God wa&slong; ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; a&slong; þe bok us deth lere
In one toumbe of Marb&rrot;e marbre he wa&slong; ileid &punctelev; &slong;w&ydot;þe faire withalle
·37·
Out of þe harde Marb&rrot;e&slong;ton &punctelev; þe o&ydot;le gan out walle
A welle of eo&ydot;le þare sp&rrot;ong out &punctelev; riȝt at is heued anon
And at is fet a welle of water &punctelev; of þe harde Marb&rrot;e&slong;ton marbreston [vv. 3178 al. om.]
Sike men þare gonnen sone &punctelev; wel þicke þudere gon
Þarof men beren wide aboute &punctelev; and ȝeot men doth also
gret botningue þar is ȝu&ydot;t &punctelev; of men þat comieth þareto
Fo&rrot; þe welle of eo&ydot;le and of watur &punctelev; ase manie men iseoth
In þe harde &slong;ton la&slong;tez ȝeot &punctelev; þare is holie bones beoth
Man&ydot; fair Miracle miracle þare[om. þare] hath of him &punctelev; sethþe he deide icome
Þei we ne mouwen nouȝt tellen alle &punctelev; we moten tellen of some.[vv. 3205 al. om.]
¶To a g&ydot;v Gyv at one t&ydot;me &punctelev; a cri&slong;tine man ȝeode
Fo&rrot;to bo&rrot;ewi gold of him &punctelev; to is muchele neode
he ne miȝte finden him nanne bo&rrot;uȝ &punctelev; ne wed nadde he non
Þane g&ydot;v Gyv to seint Nicholas churche &punctelev; he bad with him gon
Opon seint Nicholases auter he swo&rrot; &punctelev; at one certe&ydot;ne da&ydot;e
So god God him helpe and seint Nicholas &punctelev; his gold him fo&rrot;to pa&ydot;e
Þis giv Giv fo&rrot; seint Nicholas loue &punctelev; his oth nouȝt ne fo&rrot;sok
Ake seint Nicholas to bo&rrot;ewe he nam &punctelev; and þat gold him bitok
Þis luþere cri&slong;tine man &punctelev; þo it cam to is da&ydot;e
Þat gold nolde he ȝelde nouȝt &punctelev; ake þouȝte þane giv Giv bitra&ydot;e
Þe giv Giv cam and axede him &punctelev; ȝwanne he it ȝelde wolde
Þov false schrewe þe oþur seide &punctelev; ich it þe habbe iȝolde
Þe giv Giv seide na&ydot; and he ȝus &punctelev; bote al ne heold it nouȝt
Þe giv Giv let him somoni &punctelev; þat he was to court ib&rrot;ouȝt
Ake þis false cri&slong;tine man &punctelev; þouȝte op one feolle g&ydot;nne
Ane &slong;taf he nam opon is hond &punctelev; holuȝ he was withinne
Þareinne he dutte al þat gold &punctelev; þat he scholde þe giwe ȝelde
And feolliche dutte hine and fa&slong;te &punctelev; þat men ne scholden him bimelde
bifo&rrot;e þe ba&ydot;llifs hu&ydot; comen &punctelev; þe giv Giv and he boþe
he withsok þe giwes Giwes dette &punctelev; and was idon to ane oþe
Þo he scholde is oth do &punctelev; is false &slong;taf he bitok
Þe giwe and bad him ȝwitie þe ȝwile &punctelev; he leide is hond on þe bok
And seide also muche gold also ich bo&rrot;ewede &punctelev; of þe giv Giv þat here is
So helpe me cri&slong;t and seint Nicholas &punctelev; ich tok him aȝein iwis
Þis luþere man with is fals oth &punctelev; swiþe wel ileued was
And þe oþur fo&rrot; he was a giv Giv
&punctelev; noþing ileued he nas
Ȝwane þou me ha&slong;t bigiled &punctelev; with þi false cas
Ich bidde þine bo&rrot;ouȝ þat he it me ȝelde &punctelev; þe guode seint Nicholas
Þe giv Giv with wel so&rrot;ie chere &punctelev; wende him fo&rrot;th anon
And þe false man nam is &slong;taf &punctelev; and hamward bigan to gon
Also he wende bi þe weie hamward &punctelev; to slepe he hadde grete wille
Þare twei weiȝes togadere comen &punctelev; adoun he lai wel &slong;tille
As þis false man la&ydot; and slep &punctelev; a cart þare cam gon
And altob&rrot;u&ydot;sde is false bones &punctelev; þat he deide anon
Þat o ȝweol tob&rrot;ak þane false &slong;taf &punctelev; ase mani a man isaiȝ &punctelev; [Here a fol. is wanting; MS. Harl continues:]
Þat gold schadde out alabrod &punctelev; & amidde þe weye lay
¶ þe Gyw þo he þis iseȝ &punctelev; loude he gan to crie
& þonkede Seint Nicholas &punctelev; þat schewede his tricherie
For þe miracle men him radde &punctelev; Cristene forto beo
Certes ynelle quaþ þis oþer &punctelev; >er ic more iseo
Ac if god God & Seint Nicholas &punctelev; wolde þis liþer manes lyf sende
Cristene ic wolde þanne beo &punctelev; & serui hem to mi lyues ende
¶ Fram deþe to lyue þis false man &punctelev; þurf Seint Nicholas com
Anon so þe Gyw þis iseȝ &punctelev; he wilnede Cristendom
& bileouede on ihesu crist &punctelev; & god man euereft was
Þis me þinȝþ a fair miracle &punctelev; of Seint Nicholas
her ȝe seoþ hou hit goþ bi men &punctelev; þat wiþ gyle swerieþ iwis
Þeȝ he þurf gyle swerie soþ &punctelev; iwis forswore he is
¶ A god man þer was in a tyme &punctelev; þat longe was mid his wyue
Þat no childe nemiȝte habbe &punctelev; þat euere cam to lyue
To Seint Nicholas ofte hi bede &punctelev; achild hem to sende
& bihete him if hit so were &punctelev; to him forto wende
¶ Seint Nicholas ihurde here bone &punctelev; for god he is & mylde
hit biful þerafter sone &punctelev; þat his wyf was mid chylde
& brouȝte forþ afair sone &punctelev; glad þis gode man was
he let ȝarki a fair coupe &punctelev; to Seint Nicholas
So faire was þe coupe of golde &punctelev; þo heo was ȝaru iwrouȝt
& þis hosebonde heo was so leof &punctelev; þat he nolde leue hire noȝt
Ac athuld hire in his owe hous &punctelev; himsilue þerof to drinke
Anoþer to Seint Nicholas &punctelev; þe goldsmyth he let biswinke
¶ Þo þe coupe was ymaked &punctelev; to þe louerd Seint Nicholas
he wiste hire wiþ gret drueri &punctelev; ac þoþer fairere was
¶ Þo his sone was wel iwoxe &punctelev; & hadde strenȝþe & miȝte
To þe pelgrimage of Seint Nicholas &punctelev; þis gode man him diȝte
& nom wiþ him his leoue sone &punctelev; & þe coupen beye
Þe furste þat him was so leof &punctelev; to serui him bi þe weye
Þoþer to ofri Seint Nicholas &punctelev; whan hi þider come
hi greiþede hem a Godes name &punctelev; & þe holi wei hi nome
¶ So þat hi come in þe see &punctelev; as hi þane wei wende
After water of þe see &punctelev; þis gode man his sone sende
Fech me he seide of þe water &punctelev; in myn owene coupe
Þat child dude his fader heste &punctelev; & to þe water gan stoupe
Þe coupe ful out of his hond &punctelev; & anon to grounde sonk
Þe child ful in afterward &punctelev; & in þe water adronk
Gret deol makede þis gode man &punctelev; þo he seȝ þis cas
Þat he nadde bote þat o child &punctelev; & he adronke was
Awei he seide þis dai abide &punctelev; leoue louerd allas
wel ic wot ic haue agult &punctelev; þe louerd Seint Nicholas
Þat ic bynom him þe furste coupe &punctelev; louerd what schal ic do
Þerfore ic habbe ilore nou mi child &punctelev; & þe coupe also
Seint Nicholas forȝif hit me &punctelev; & ynelle noȝt bileue iwis
Þat ynelle siche þe &punctelev; þeȝ me beo bifalle þis
¶ Þis gode man [him] wende forþ &punctelev; in deol & sori þoȝt
Er he to Seint Nicholas com &punctelev; he neturnde aȝe noȝt
Þo he to þe weued com &punctelev; þat he hadde wide isoȝt
Þe coupe he offrede þerto &punctelev; þat he hadde þider ibroȝt
þe coupe hipte anon aȝe &punctelev; he nolde astinte þere
Ac hipte into þe flor &punctelev; wreche as þeȝ hit were
Þis gode man hire nom vp &punctelev; & offrede hire eft þere
Eftsone heo hipte fram þe weued &punctelev; forþere þan heo dude ere
¶ Þo was þis gode man agrise &punctelev; & þoþere aboute also
Louerd he seide Seint Nicholas &punctelev; ic haue þe moche misdo
Ich wolde offri þoþer coupe &punctelev; ac ynemai þerto come
vnderfong þus if hit beo þi wille &punctelev; for þoþer me is bynome
vnderfong þoþer of mi sone &punctelev; for þu wost wher he is
Let mi sone to þe offri þulke &punctelev; & let me offri þis
For no hope of his sones lyf &punctelev; þe gode man þis nesede
Ac for he scholde his soule helpe &punctelev; & þe whatlokere do what he bede
¶ Mid þis word þer com in &punctelev; his sone þat was adronke
& bar þe coupe on his hond &punctelev; þat was mid him asonke
To þe weued he ȝeode & offrede &punctelev; to Seint Nicholas
wele louerd þe grete ioye &punctelev; þat of þe miracle was
Gladliche þe fader & þe sone &punctelev; here offring vp bere
& wende hom wiþ gret ioye &punctelev; & leuede þe coupen þere
& herede moche Seint Nicholas &punctelev; as hi wel auȝte iwis
Meni is þe faire miracle &punctelev; þat of Seint Nicholas is
¶ A Gyw was while in a tyme &punctelev; þat ihurde meni o tale
Of þe miracles of Seint Nicholas &punctelev; þat he dude so fale
So >þat þeȝ he were a Gyw &punctelev; vpe him his hurte he caste
& honurede him ynouȝ &punctelev; & biþoȝte him atte laste
An ymage priueiliche he makede &punctelev; of Seint Nicholas
& honurede hit in his hous &punctelev; þo hit ȝare was
¶ In a tyme hit biful &punctelev; þat he hadde to done
In þe contrai þeraboute &punctelev; to come aȝe wel sone
he nuste wham his god bitake &punctelev; forte he aȝe come
Seint Nicholas ymage he bad &punctelev; nyme þerto gode gome
Ich þe habbe he seide iloued ynouȝ &punctelev; do me som god þerfore
wite mi god forte ic come &punctelev; þat hit ne beo forlore
For bi Seint Nicholas þat ic louie &punctelev; if hit beo awei ibore
whan ic come aȝe þu schalt &punctelev; sore abigge þerfore
Þe Gyw wende forþ his wei &punctelev; & tok al his god to wite
Þe ymage forte he come aȝe &punctelev; as hit is iwrite
Siþþe hit biful þat liþere men &punctelev; & þeoues þer come
·37· Nich 37 115
And tob&rrot;eken þe giwe&slong; Giwes hous &punctelev; and is guod awei nome
Þo þe giv Giv cam hom aȝein &punctelev; and mi&slong;te al is govod
gret deol he made and &slong;eo&rrot;uwe inovȝ &punctelev; and ferde a&slong;e he were wod
to þane &ydot;mage he wende anon &punctelev; a&slong;e he bi þe walle &slong;tod
Seie he &slong;eide ȝwat haue&slong;t þou ido &punctelev; þou haue&slong;t iset harm ab&rrot;od
Ich bitok þe to witene al mi guod &punctelev; þat god God lente me
hit is nouþe al ibo&rrot;e awei &punctelev; and þat ich wite þe
Ȝwan ich it bitok þe in warde &punctelev; and þou were of pou&slong;te
to witen it wel ȝif þat þou wolde&slong;t &punctelev; þarefo&rrot;e þou haue maugre
Fo&rrot; ȝwane ich tru&slong;te &slong;o muche to þe &punctelev; and þou nolde&slong;t do mi bone
bi riȝte lawe a&slong;e ich þe bihet &punctelev; þov &slong;chalt abugge sone
Ȝwane þou ȝolde mine godhede &punctelev; &slong;o vuele atþe la&slong;te
harde &slong;courgene he nam and &slong;tronge &punctelev; and beot þis &ydot;mage wel fa&slong;te
Þat grete pece&slong; bo&rrot;&slong;ten awei &punctelev; he ferde a&slong;e he were wod
And euere he bad þat &slong;eli treo &punctelev; b&rrot;ingue aȝen is guod
Seint Nichola&slong; þareafterward &slong;one &punctelev; to þe þeoue&slong; wende
Al fo&rrot;woundet and tod&rrot;awe &punctelev; a&slong;e þe giv Giv him torende
Lo he &slong;eide hov ich am fo&rrot; ov &punctelev; Iwoundet iwoundet and fo&rrot;gnawe
blok and blodi a&slong;e ȝe i&slong;eoth &punctelev; and al mi bodi tod&rrot;awe
bringez aȝen ich red ov &slong;one &punctelev; þat ȝe habbez aȝenwei⁁ ibo&rrot;e ·wei·
⁁
And i&slong;tole of þe giwe&slong; Giwes guode &punctelev; oþur ȝe &slong;chulle hangi þarefo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot;&slong;oþe i &slong;egge ȝe &slong;chullen hangen &punctelev; bote ȝe it hom anon lede
Ȝe &slong;chullen &slong;ome abugge with me &punctelev; ouwer foule mi&slong;dede
Þeo&slong; þeoue&slong; weren &slong;o&rrot;e ofd&rrot;adde &punctelev; heo nomen heom to rede
And ladden hom aȝein þe giwe&slong; Giwes guod &punctelev; hu&ydot; ne do&rrot;&slong;ten oþur fo&rrot; fered&rrot;ede
And weren aknowe of al ho&rrot;e gult &punctelev; and þe Miracle miracle him sede
hov &slong;eint Nicholas to heom cam &punctelev; with is &slong;idene blodrede
Þe giv Giv and þe þeue&slong; al&slong;o &punctelev; to &slong;eint Nichola&slong; bede
Þat he fo&rrot;ȝeue heom heo&rrot;e gult &punctelev; and nolden mo&rrot;e don to quede
Þe þeue&slong; bicomen trewe men &punctelev; and ne &slong;telen neuereft mo&rrot;e
And þe giv Giv him let cri&slong;tn&ydot; &slong;one &punctelev; and tok him alto gode&slong; Godes lo&rrot;e
And euereft mo&rrot;e euerechone &punctelev; loueden &slong;eint Nicholas
Me þincheth among alle oþere &punctelev; a fair Miracle miracle þat was
¶In anoþur time a guod man was &punctelev; þat hadde a clerk to &slong;one
Eche ȝere he wolde fo&rrot; is loue &punctelev; a &slong;eint Nicholas dai bi wone
Of manie clerku&slong; gret fe&slong;te holden &punctelev; and wurth&slong;chipien seint Nichola&slong; al&slong;o
with offringue and &slong;erui&slong;e at churche &punctelev; gret honur him do
Þe feond hadde þarto onde &punctelev; a dai a&slong;e
he cam þere
A &slong;eint Nicholas da&ydot; to þe ȝate &punctelev; a&slong;e þei it a beggare were
And bad fo&rrot; seint Nicholas loue &punctelev; þat man &slong;um guod heoim ȝeoue
Anon &slong;o þat child wu&slong;te him þere &punctelev; he nolde no leng bileue
Ake b&rrot;ed he nam in is hond &punctelev; þane &slong;ch&rrot;ewe fo&rrot;to beode
And þo þat child cam toward þe ȝate &punctelev; þe sch&rrot;ewe aweiward ȝeode
Þat child eode euere afterward &punctelev; to ȝiuen him of þe b&rrot;ede
Ake he ȝeode euere fo&rrot;th a&slong;e it were &punctelev; aweiward þat child to lede
vita sc&combtilde;i sancti
Nicħ&mmiddot;
ame&combmacr; amen
And þo he cam into a derne &slong;tude &punctelev; he biturnde him ate la&slong;te
A&slong;e it were to nime þat b&rrot;ed &punctelev; and anon he nam wel fa&slong;te
aÞat child bi⁁is &slong;eli þ⁁rote &punctelev; and a&slong;tranglede him anon
Þat child lai þare and deide &slong;one &punctelev; and þe sch&rrot;ewe awei gan gon
Þe guode man þo he mi&slong;te is child &punctelev; he &slong;ouȝte it wel wide
Ake þo he fond it ligge aslawe &punctelev; wel deolfulliche he cride·
Louerd he seide seint icholas &punctelev; ich bidde þe milce and o&rrot;e
honoured ich þe habbe mani a dai &punctelev; ant ȝeot ich hopie mo&rrot;e
And fo&rrot; anchai&slong;un of mi &slong;one &punctelev; þe mo&rrot;e and fo&rrot; is lo&rrot;e
Þat þou me &slong;ende&slong;t Ioie ioie of him &punctelev; and &slong;childe&slong;t me fram &slong;o&rrot;e
Ȝwi ȝel&slong;tov mine ȝw&ydot;le þus &punctelev; louerd ȝwi de&slong;t þou so
hov miȝt þou þus seint Nicholas &punctelev; fo&rrot; reuþe bi me þdo
Ȝif me gladne&slong;&slong;e of mi child &punctelev; þat ich mote him aliue iseo
And ich him bihote to þine serui&slong;e &punctelev; and þat he &slong;chal guod man beo
A&slong;e he wa&slong; þus in is beden &punctelev; þat child aros op allone
And herede god God and &slong;eint Nichola&slong; &punctelev; among heom euerechone
Þat him hadde lijf i&slong;ent &punctelev; fo&rrot; is fader bone þer
And he tolde alhou þe deuel hadde &punctelev; him a&slong;trangled er
Fo&rrot; al&slong;o muche a&slong;e he honourede &slong;o &punctelev; þane guode seint Nicholas
Þis me þinchez among alle oþere &punctelev; a fair Miracle miracle it wa&slong;
Louerd
þat fo&rrot; þe loue of seint Nicholas &punctelev; mani Miracle miracle ha&slong;t ido
Þou &slong;child u&slong; fram þe pine of helle &punctelev; and fram dedliche &slong;unne al&slong;o
